thread.title: Ed Stockton
thread.title_full: Disc Makers reviewed by Ed Stockton

author: Ed Stockton
title: Ed Stockton
text:
My CD was a lifelong dream. When the time came to quit fooling around in the studio and actually release the project Disk Makers guided me through each step. I had planned to use Harry Fox for cover songs, but used Easy Song Licensing instead because it kept all work on the project under one umbrella. (And I think they were actually a little cheaper.)
Artwork was a problem for me. I had the cover photo I planned to use, and some other helpful pictures, but Disk Maker's art department put it all together much better than I could have imagined. And then I used their Mastering service. My own mixes could sound good on my home stereo OR my car OR my earphones. The mix that came back sounds great no matter where I play it. In my day job I am an engineer, but I cannot imagine what they did with that Mastering service. It appears to be an example of the old saying, "any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic."
I had not even considered selling the project on CD Baby, but Disk Makers' distribution package was so easy to use there was no reason not to do it. And I love the commemorative plaque they offered. It certainly marks a milestone in my musical experience.
The whole experience was seamless and easy. I got timely calls from their project people to make sure all my questions were answered and to keep me updated. It's hard to believe such a complex process could be so easy and fun.
